snippet: The group, the Abdullah Azzam Brigades, claimed responsibility for a suicide attack on the Iranian Embassy in Beirut in November.
abstract: Lebanese military authorities detain Majid bin Muhammad al-Majid, Saudi leader of a Sunni militant group linked to Al Qaeda that claimed responsibility for a double suicide bomb attack on the Iranian Embassy in Beirut in November; detention provokes array of political responses in region, latest sign that the power struggle between Saudi Arabia and Iran is intensifying in neighboring Lebanon.
lead_paragraph: The group, the Abdullah Azzam Brigades, claimed responsibility for a suicide attack on the Iranian Embassy in Beirut in November.

headline.main: Lebanon Arrests Leader of Qaeda-Linked Group, Reports Say
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Arrests Leader of Qaeda-Linked Group, Reports Say
